summary: Save&Reload HUD layouts created with MinimalHUD.
descriptionHtml:
[size=+1][b]This mod is now an integral part of the main [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/33482]MinimalHUD[/url] mod and is therefore OBSOLETE. 
See uninstall instructions below![/size][/b] 


[color=yellow]Description[/color] 
For those who don’t know, [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/33482]MinimalHUD[/url] is a great (and pretty underrated) mod that lets you create a custom HUD layout by resizing and repositioning the basic HUD elements. It is one of my favorite mods, though it has one downside: It only saves your layout 
in the savegame file, which means that you have to readjust the HUD everytime you start a new game.

MininmalHUD LayoutManager changes that.


[color=yellow]How does it work?[/color]
 MininmalHUD LayoutManager is easy to use. It adds a submenu called \"Layout Manager\" to the MinimalHUD MCM. Once you have set up your HUD in MinimalHUD, go to the \"Layout Manager\" page and click “Save Layout”. When starting a new game go to the menu again and select “Load Layout” and you’re done.

[color=yellow]Installation[/color]
You need the original MinimalHUD 0.5, SKSE and SkyUI installed. Extract the archive into your Skyrim/Data folder.

 [color=yellow]Uninstall[/color]
delete the following file: Skyrim/Data/scripts/minHUDconfig.pex 


[b]Thanks to LordConti for his support and insight into his mod. [/b]
